meanings.definition: Lack of moderation or restraint in behavior or actions.
meanings.sent1: His immoderations at the party led to embarrassing behavior.
meanings.sent2: Her immoderations in spending often left her in debt.
meanings.sent3: The immoderations of the puppy running around the house were both cute and chaotic.
meanings.sent4: The immoderations of the storm caused widespread damage to the town.
meanings.sent5: The immoderations of the student's excitement during the school play were contagious.

meanings.definition: Excessive indulgence in something, typically food or drink.
meanings.sent1: His immoderations at the buffet left him feeling uncomfortably full.
meanings.sent2: The immoderations of the chocolate cake were evident in her satisfied smile.
meanings.sent3: The immoderations of the ice cream lover resulted in brain freeze.
meanings.sent4: Her immoderations with shopping bags made her friends worry about her finances.
meanings.sent5: The immoderations of the chef's seasoning transformed the dish into a culinary masterpiece.
